"""
Created on 27.12.2013

import unittest
from bruch import Bruch



[docs]class TestAddition(unittest.TestCase):


[docs]    def setUp(self):
        self.b = Bruch(3, 2)
        self.b2 = Bruch(self.b)
        self.b3 = Bruch(4, 2)
        pass



[docs]    def tearDown(self):
        del self.b, self.b2, self.b3
        pass



[docs]    def testplus(self):
        self.b = self.b + Bruch(4, 5)
        assert(float(self.b) == 2.3)



[docs]    def testplus2(self):
        self.b = self.b + self.b3
        assert(float(self.b) == 3.5)



[docs]    def testplus3(self):
        self.b2 = self.b + 3
        assert(float(self.b2) == 4.5)



[docs]    def testradd(self):
        self.b2 = 3 + Bruch(3, 2)
        assert(float(self.b2) == 4.5)



[docs]    def testiAdd(self):
        self.b += 1
        assert(self.b == Bruch(5, 2))



[docs]    def testiAdd2(self):
        self.b += Bruch(1)
        assert(self.b == Bruch(5, 2))



[docs]    def testaddError(self):
        self.assertRaises(TypeError, self.b2.__add__, 2.0)



[docs]    def testiAddError(self):
        self.assertRaises(TypeError, self.b.__iadd__, "other")



if __name__ == "__main__":
    unittest.main()
